result.description: This technical report describes the overall architecture and how the different components interact. The main purpose of the document is to define best practices and standards for integrating the different technical components in policy making processes and tools.

result.title: Data Management Plan (Iter. 1)
result.description: DMP describes the data management life cycle for all data sets that will be collected, processed or generated by the research project. It is a document outlining how research data will be handled during a research project, and even after the project is completed, describing what data will be collected, processed or generated and following what methodology and standards, whether and how this data will be shared and/or made open, and how it will be curated and preserved. The DPM will be defined at very early stage of the project and will be updated continuously with new submissions at M12, M24 and M36.

result.title: Communication and Dissemination Plan v2
result.description: The Communication and Dissemination plan will detail the stages and process involved in the promotion and awareness raising of the project including the dissemination of information among target groups (quadruple helix) with the ability to contribute to the innovation and success of the project. This information will be shared through-out the duration of the project, highlighting its goals, objectives and activities, in all cases respecting any IPR restrictions.

result.title: Metadata Specifications
result.description: This technical document describes the metadata requirements (incl. use of standards) for successful application of technical components in policy making processes and tools. The report will also document the gap between those requirements and the most popular open source metadata software.

result.title: Final Project Results Report
result.description:
This report expresses our vision on the future for ATM sector in Europe from an institutional perspective. It describes our view on potential pathways towards new institutional designs for the European ATM sector. These institutional elements will likely include more competitive dynamics that should lead to performance improvements on various ATM key performance areas. We will also investigate ways of implementation. This involves understanding distributional impacts and possibly the need for government oversight and enforcement for effectively implementing proposed changes. This report will also discuss potential drawbacks and ways of addressing perverse incentives in new institutional designs. This can include ways of overcoming potential market concentration of ATM service provision in the hands of just a few ANSPs.
The report also contains a concise executive summary which outlines the main idea of the project, the approach taken, the main results and policy recommendations that we can derive from it.

result.title: Report on economic analysis
result.description: This report describes the economic modelling approach and the results obtained. In this report, we highlight the underlying dynamics on how institutional market designs and competitive dynamics affect performance. These mechanisms will be used as a foundation for the simulation models of WP4.

result.title: Report on Future Internet research and innovation plicies and ecosystems in China
result.description: This report will provide a comprehensive analysis of Chinas Innovative Ecosystem and specifically, will identify innovation support mechanisms regarding: 1) Public policies on innovation; 2) Capacity Building on innovation; 3) Evaluating the Chinese research and innovation capabilities; 4) Supporting schemes and initiatives for international Science, Technology and Innovation collaboration, with a focus on Future Internet; 5) Regulations and financial incentives that support innovation and internationalisation; 6) Opportunities and obstacles for the innovation ecosystem.

result.title: Quantitative impact assessment summary report
result.description: This report will be an accessible text without complicated formulas or graphs. It will summarize the main insights of both models in terms of the approach used and its limitations, the main results and the policy recommendations that one can derive from this. The comprehensive assessment framework and the common model guidelines allow us to consistently evaluate various options, even using a different model approach. Effects will be quantified and illustrate impacts on performance metrics, economic impacts and other relevant indicators of the assessment framework.

result.title: Report on institutional design options
result.description:
This report describes all the institutional options for introducing more competitive dynamics in European air traffic management. Each of the options contains a detailed description of the roles of various actors: Who has the right to provide a specific service? How to obtain and/or trade these rights? Which actor is responsible for key air traffic management tasks?
For each of the options, we also make an initial qualitative characterization of feasibility and expected effects: how to effectively realize this institutional design? And how will this change operational models of ANSPs and required skills and tasks of their employees?

result.title: Effects of increased flexibility for airspace users on network performance
result.description: In this deliverable, we incorporate recommendations received from stakeholders, airspace users in particular. Namely, we update the COCTA model, in line with refined COCTA concept of capacity and demand management. In the refined concept airlines will be able to define their preferred trajectories and the flexibility required for each flight, as well as to decide on the final trajectory. We analyse and evaluate the effects on network performance.
